properties.Name: CommercialLeaseAgreement
properties.Description: A Commercial Lease is used to lease a building or commercial property for a commercial purposes.

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.

Columns.Name: AgreementEffectiveDate
Columns.Description: The effective date that the lease agreement becomes legally binding.

Columns.Name: LeasedPremisesDescription
Columns.Description: A description of the premises to be leased.

Columns.Name: TermSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the terms of the lease.

Columns.Name: RentalSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the annual rental or lease amount.

Columns.Name: UseSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the uses of the property that is being leased to insure that they are compatible with the objectives of the lessor.

Columns.Name: SubleaseAndAssignmentSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the conditions under which the tenant may assign lease rights to a third party.

Columns.Name: RepairsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that the Tenant is responsible for most repairs to the leased commercial premises and the conditions under which the Tenant is not responsible.

Columns.Name: AlterationsAndImprovementsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the conditions under which the Tenant may make alternations and improvements to the commercial property and at whose expense those alternations are proportioned as well as Tenant's responsibilities should the alterations and improvements result in damage to the property.

Columns.Name: PropertyTaxesSection
Columns.Description: This section clarifies who is responsible for payment of various taxes on the commercial property.

Columns.Name: InsuranceSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes which party has the obligation to provide insurance for the commercial property.

Columns.Name: UtilitiesSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes which party has responsibility for the utilities supporting the associated commercial property.

Columns.Name: SignsSection
Columns.Description: This section governs the posting of signs by tenants in the commercial property.

Columns.Name: EntrySection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the right of the landlord to enter the leased premises at any reasonable time.    It also governs the right of the tenant to not be interfered with by the landlord during the pursuit of normal business obligations.

Columns.Name: ParkingSection
Columns.Description: This section governs the right of the tenant to park or assume parking in the commercial property identifies in the lease.

Columns.Name: BuildingRulesSection
Columns.Description: This section governs the landlord's rules and regulation regarding the commercial property and the compliance required by tenants.

Columns.Name: DamageAndDestructionSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the rights of parties should the commercial property become damaged by fire or similar casualty.

Columns.Name: DefaultSection
Columns.Description: This section governs the obligations to pay rent and comply with lease terms.   It typically also allows the landlord to terminate the lease if the tenant does not comply with lease provisions.

Columns.Name: QuitePossessionSection
Columns.Description: This refers to the tenant being entitled to the 'quite enjoyment' of the leased commercial premises - which is the right to use the leased premises without being disturbed by the landlord assuming that the tenant complies with the lease.

Columns.Name: CondemnationSection
Columns.Description: This section deals with the right of government to condemn property for 'eminent domain', which means that should the building be taken by the government for such purposes the lease will be terminated when transferred to the state.

Columns.Name: SubordinationSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the tenants interest in the lease subordinate to any mortgage or other lien on the premises.

Columns.Name: SecurityDepositSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the rights of each party in the security deposit paid by the tenant.  Essentially, as long as the tenant performs their obligations they are entitled to a refund of the security deposit.

Columns.Name: WaiverSection
Columns.Description: This section makes clear that a single waiver to the contract does not constitute a waiver in other cases.

Columns.Name: MemorandumOfLeaseSection
Columns.Description: This section makes it clear that the parties involved in the lease do not intend to make public any filing of the lease.

Columns.Name: SuccessorsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that should anyone else become a party to the lease because of assignment, sale or any similar transaction, the new party is bound at all times by the same terms of the lease.

Columns.Name: ConsentSection
Columns.Description: This section requires the landlord to be reasonable and consistent when considering a request by the tenant to assign of sublease the property (i.e.. the landlord must have some real business reason for withholding consent).

Columns.Name: PerformanceSection
Columns.Description: This section provides additional means for the tenant to address problems of non-performance by the landlord.

Columns.Name: ComplianceWithLawSection
Columns.Description: This section includes the agreement of each party to comply with applicable laws.

Columns.Name: FinalAgreementSection
Columns.Description: This section makes it clear that this is the final agreement between parties and replaces or supersedes any prior discussions or agreements.    Any amendments to this agreement must be made in writing.

Columns.Name: LeaseTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a lease type.

Properties.Description: A Commercial Lease is used to lease a building or commercial property for a commercial purposes.
